Union: Painters District Council 5, Carpet, Linoleum and Soft Tile Layers Union 1238
Unit Description:
All full-time and regular part-time employees of Tacoma Custom Carpets, Inc. including journeymen, apprentices, foremen and other persons engaged in floor and decorative covering work (see description on the Attachment) who are employed on all present and future job sites within the Washington State counties of Pierce, Thurston, Lewis, Mason, Grays Harbor, Pacific,  Jefferson and Clallam..


Floor and Decorative Coverings Workers work will include, but not be limited to: (1) measuring, cutting, fabricating, fitting, installing to be cemented, tacked or otherwise applied to its base and/or underlayments(s) wherever it may be, all materials whether used either as a decorative covering, topping or as an acoustical appliance such as carpets of all types and designs, sheet rubber, sheet linoleum, sheet vinyl, laminate floors and laminate floor systems, cork carpet, rubber tile, asphalt tile, tile, cork tile, linoleum tile, mastic in sheets or tile form, vinyl tile, interlocking tile, mastipave, composition in sheet or tile form and all derivatives of above; artificial turf and derivatives thereof, including infilled sports turf; all resilient seamless materials such as epoxy, polyurethane plastics and their derivatives, components and systems, prefinished glue down and floating hardwood, plastic laminate, plastic materials, non-slip or abrasive materials, oil cloth, matting, linen and crash, mastic tile, and decorative seamless surface coatings; (2) the fitting of all devices for the attachment of the above materials and the fitting of all decorative or protective trim to and adjoining the above materials which shall include the drilling and plugging of holes and attaching of strips, slats, nosing, etc., on any base and/or underlayment(s) where the above materials are to be installed or applied, such as drilling, plugging and slatting for installing or fastening of carpet, the installing of all nosing, cap strips, corner beads and edgings of any material and the preparatory work of the craft for all of the aforesaid, which includes but is not limited to, substrate preparation and the application of all self leveling, trowelable and board underlayments; (3) the removal of the aforementioned installed material from its base and/or underlayment as required; (4) the cleaning of rugs and carpets and all drapery hanging, make-up and the installation of drapes and window treatments.  In addition prefinished glue down and floating hardwood, plastic laminate, plastic materials, non-slip or abrasive materials, oil cloth, matting, linen and crash, mastic tile, decorative seamless surface coating, and asphalt plank.

Union: District Council No. 3 of the International  Union of Painters and Allied Trades, AFL-CIO, of Greater Kansas City and Vicinity
Unit Description: All full-time and regular part-time employees employed by the Employer from its facility located at 4710 Mission Rd., Roeland Park, KS, 66205, and working in the following counties: Bates, Benton, Caldwell, Carroll, Cass, Clay, Clinton, Cooper, Daviess, Grundy, Harrison, Henry, Jackson, Johnson, Lafayette, Livingston, Mercer, Moniteau, Morgan, Pettis, Platte, Ray, and Saline in Missouri and Johnson, Leavenworth, Linn, Miami and Wyandotte in Kansas who are performing work that has been historically and traditionally done by employees represented by the Union including but not limited to; the removal, application, and disposal of paint products including but not limited to enamels, epoxies, faux finishes, glazes, lacquers, latexes, fillers, urethanes, sealants, stains, and other products of this nature on all interior and exterior surfaces whether for protective, decorative, stripping, scenic, or any other purposes as well as preparation of the surfaces the products are to be applied to; lead paint abatement, removal, containment and disposal; blasting and cleaning with abrasives and/or liquids, the removal of existing wall or ceiling covering, preparation for and installation of wall and ceiling coverings including paper, cloths, vinyl, and similar products that apply directly to walls as a decorative covering; the application and sanding of drywall  joint compound, textures, seam tape, corner beads, expansion joints, texturing, and other products used to finish drywall board, lathed surfaces, and any other surface; the operation of any tools used for the above scopes of work including but not limited to brushes, rollers, sprayers, blasting equipment, air supply systems, drywall boxes, pans, knives, mechanical equipment, used to apply and sand drywall joint compound and textures as well as products related to drywall finishing, wall covering, hand tools and machines, but EXCLUDING clerical employees, managerial employees, supervisors as defined in the Act, and all other employees

lead paint abatement, removal, containment and disposal; blasting and cleaning with abrasives and/or liquids, the removal of existing wall or ceiling covering, preparation for and installation of wall and ceiling coverings including paper, cloths, vinyl, and similar products that apply directly to walls as a decorative covering; the application and sanding of drywall  joint compound, textures, seam tape, corner beads, expansion joints, texturing, and other products used to finish drywall board, lathed surfaces, and any other surface; the operation of any tools used for the above scopes of work including but not limited to brushes, rollers, sprayers, blasting equipment, air supply systems, drywall boxes, pans, knives, mechanical equipment, used to apply and sand drywall joint compound and textures as well as products related to drywall finishing, wall covering, hand tools and machines, but EXCLUDING clerical employees, managerial employees, supervisors as defined in the Act, and all other employees.

Union: Painters District Council 5, Local 300
Unit Description: All steps to execution of drywall finishing, spackling of all surfaces and application of texture finishes where adhesive materials are used, thin wall, radiant heat fill and all preparatory work of spotting, taping, finishing and sanding of joints and surfaces. Drywall work also includes the handling of all preparatory work incidental to drywall finishing of any surfaces. The grouting and caulking of door jambs, caulking between sheetrock walls and/or ceilings and adjoining walls, ceilings, and floors of other material, spray fireproofing, firestopping, application of exterior insulation and/or finishes, flushing of concrete, steel, wood, or plaster surfaces and all other work which is usually executed by drywall tapers and finishers; and the operation and care on the job site of all tools and equipment used by all trades coming under the jurisdiction of the International Union of Painters and Allied Trades. Drywall work also includes work, materials, equipment or processes that are substituted for the matters described above.

Unit Description: All full-time and regular part-time employees employed by the Employer from its facility located at 2530 Bayard, Kansas City, Kansas 66105, and working in the following counties: Bates, Benton, Caldwell, Carroll, Cass, Clay, Clinton, Cooper, Daviess, Grundy, Harrison, Henry, Jackson, Johnson, Lafayette, Livingston, Mercer, Moniteau, Morgan, Pettis, Platte, Ray, and Saline in Missouri and Johnson, Leavenworth, Linn, Miami and Wyandotte in Kansas who are performing work that has been historically and traditionally done by employees represented by the Union including but not limited to; the removal, application, and disposal of paint products including but not limited to enamels, epoxies, faux finishes, glazes, lacquers, latexes, fillers, urethanes, sealants, stains, and other products of this nature on all interior and exterior surfaces whether for protective, decorative, stripping, scenic, or any other purposes as well as preparation of the surfaces the products are to be applied to; lead paint abatement, removal, containment and disposal; blasting and cleaning with abrasives and/or liquids, the removal of existing wall or ceiling covering, preparation for and installation of wall and ceiling coverings including paper, cloths, vinyl, and similar products that apply directly to walls as a decorative covering; the application and sanding of drywall  joint compound, textures, seam tape, corner beads, expansion joints, texturing, and other products used to finish drywall board, lathed surfaces, and any other surface; the operation of any tools used for the above scopes of work including but not limited to brushes, rollers, sprayers, blasting equipment, air supply systems, drywall boxes, pans, knives, mechanical equipment, used to apply and sand drywall joint compound and textures as well as products related to drywall finishing, wall covering, hand tools and machines, but EXCLUDING clerical employees, managerial employees, supervisors as defined in the Act, and all other employees.
